description: When someone sends an issue number in chat, for example: #123, Wynem will automatically recognise it, and if it matches an issue from the configured GitHub repository, will reply with an embed detailing the mentioned issue.

description.text: How to use the issue tracker

tabs.name: Setting a GitHub repo
content: To configure a GitHub repo to use for issue tracking, run the e!setissuetracker [url]/serverconfig setissuetracker url:[url] command, for example: e!setissuetracker https://github.com/JannisX11/blockbench/serverconfig setissuetracker url:https://github.com/JannisX11/blockbench.

data.title: Issue tracker enabled
data.description: The issue tracker has been enabled for the repository https://github.com/JannisX11/blockbench

content: To remove the configured GitHub repo, simply run the same command but without a URL: e!setissuetracker/serverconfig setissuetracker

data.description: Are you sure you want to remove the issue tracker https://github.com/JannisX11/blockbench/issues/ ?

content: You will be prompted to confirm you want to remove the issue tracker. Click remove to continue.

data.title: Issue tracker removed
data.description: The issue tracker has been removed from the server

tabs.name: Viewing issues
content: To view an issue, you can either use the e!issue [issueNumber]/server issuetracker issue issueNumber:[issueNumber] command, or just send the issue number in chat, following the formatting of: #123

author: Wynem Issue Tracker

fields: The issue tracker doesn't reply to issue numbers correctly

content: If you want to disable issue numbers being automatically detected in chat, you can use the e!toggleautoissues/serverconfig toggle autoissues command.

data.description: I will no longer automatically reply to GitHub issue numbers in this server
